title.narrative: STRENGTHENING STATISTICAL & INFORMATIONSYSTEMS AND EVIDENCE GENERATION

description.narrative: The National Statistics Institute and statistical actors at social ministries at the central and decentralized levels in targeted areas have increased capacity to produce, disseminate and use data for advocacy, planning, monitoring, evaluation and accountability., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most marginalized children, adolescents and young people benefit from evidence-based social and economic policies and social protection programmes that address multidimensional poverty and advance the equitable realization of their rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The National Statistics Institute and statistical actors at social ministries at the central and decentralized levels in targeted areas have increased capacity to produce, disseminate and use data for advocacy, planning, monitoring, evaluation and accountability.

description.narrative: The national evaluation policy has been adopted, thus opening good prospects for the institutionalization of evaluation within the public administration. Even though the question of the availability and the quality of data remains a challenge, the dialogue initiated around information systems between the NIS as major data producer and the Ministry in charge of the National development Plan (PDES) monitoring as well as the migration of the national database to a newer platform initiated during 2019 constitute positive dynamics for improving the national information system and its governance. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of regional PDES monitoring mechanisms using updated regional databases as main sources of information and analysis.

Number of actors trained on the use of survey results and data analyzes for social sectors advocacy at critical planning & budgeting moments at regional and municipal (Regional directorates, regional universities, CSOs, media and municipalities) with UNICEF support.
Number of sectors with routine information systems providing information on the performance indicators of the social sector program budgets (health, education, WASH, child protection, population)
Number of survey reports and child rights related data analysis produced and disseminated with UNICEF support
Percentage of planned activities in the annual IMERP that are completed within the timeframe.
